setup.question: What was the blue spectral vehicle Dan acquired?

Text.text: The difference between the two options seems to be whether it's purpose is to move through time or contain despite dimensions? So A makes more sense?

Dan is a art enthusiast but his true love is time machines. Not really revealed why he wants one but he is determined to get one. There are some art thieves stealing art and so he finds employment to guard an unrobbed art collector to try and get them to bring him along but the two thieves obv freak out. (two thieves arrive in the blue spec vehicle).
after a scuffle dan steals the time machine:
Dan commandeers an
. The difference, as you said, is the functionality: explained here
. In my next speech I'll give textual ev for the difference in dimensionality that doesn't indicate skipping in time.

Does B agree with A's narrative?

Both words appear in text but near "vehicle"... who is misquoting?
Prove what it is actually used for
B is misquoting: here is the end of the sentence:

judge is right, the vehicle is capable of 3d travel and time travel. 

More ev on Dan controlling the time machine:
more ev to corroborate the story of Dan's plan to take the time machine by working in the art vault and waiting for the art thieves:
more ev that time machines exists in the story world:
ooh debater A is misquoting like crazy. i'm glad they brought up 5030-5036 because
is the full quote - essentially, Dan is assuming the blue spectral vehicle is a time machine, but this is debunked when he arrives at the person who facilitated the art heist.

i can quote more from this exchange in the next speech but youll notice that A has neglected to include large portions from the latter half of the story, where it is confirmed that the vehicle is not in fact a time machine but an interdimensional cage

Slightly in favor of A, bc B, if there is ev that *proves* the stolen thing can travel thru dimension but not time, you would’ve or should’ve given it already. What I'm understanding is that (1) it might be shaped like a cage and travel through dimensions... but (2) it might actually be used to travel through time

We need to settle the narrative

I. the vehicle, which i would appreciate more of, is used in a heist. not sure who are the thieves, which side they belong to
II. Dan gets it (the vehicle?, either time machine or .. ) from them, somehow
III. A, why does B say that Dan is getting the time machine from Blote?
IV. B says what Dan steals in part II is discovered to not actually be a time machine

I. thieves are an independent group(?) not exactly sure what the question is here
II. Dan gets in after scuffling with the thieves. He steals one of their guns and threatens to let one of them take him. The pretend to comply but try and fight him. The guards of the art gallery come in and a scuffle ensues. Dan uses the chaos to hop on the time machine.
III. since its a story on time travel; it's confusing to what happens first/second. the second half of the story is actually in the past. 
IV: the two of them travel to a time machine assembly center:
I. the thieves are hired by

II. agree w A 
III. the story remains chronological, no ev to back up time skip claim
IV: quoting is irrelevant, occurs after the vehicle in question is acquired.
-  they use the vehicle to travel to an address, not a time, why else would he put an address in the machine.

Okay, making progress. Now both debaters have agreed that there's
* Blote who hires Dan, with the incentive to get what Blote claims to be a time machine
* Dan gets machine while thieves are preoccupied
A, your first speech was a bit confusing about the above points. Especially after what B says in second speech

We still have disagreement for III-IV:
III. A, give me the strongest evidence possible of a time skip not only time machines, e.g. quote of Time A, time travel with blue vehicle, then Time B
IV. A, why bring up time machine assembly center? If anything it's making me think that Dan gets the time machine there, and the thieves' blue vehicle is irrelevant
B, *prove* "this is debunked" from second speech. Or else.
III. This is Dan rehearsing his speech at the beginning:
IV: They bring the machine in order to get repairs: the machine is required for the time machine:
the 'debunked' part is the entire conversation where Dan thinks the machine is a time machine, and Blote responds by saying its not, and that he didn't even know time traveling was possible.
i can quote more of this convo in the next speeches.

A, give me evidence of the time skip from in between the heist and getting the machine (ends at 3045 from what I know) and the Blote conversation which you say is in a different time (starts at 4667 according to B). Does Dan find the time switch?

B, your timeline is confusing me. In that same conversation, Blote asks what a time machine is... then proceeds to offer one... yet Blote facilitated the art heist for the machine that Dan already got which you claim he figures out isn't a time machine when he meets Blote?The only way your timeline makes sense is if
Blote hired Dan to guard
for some reason Dan takes the thieves vehicle thinking it's a time machine
Dan goes to Blote wants a real time machine
they go to factory get blue time machine
This is his first meeting with the two thieves:
but he meets them again in the past again at the beginnign of the story:

this is from the same section where Dan is rehearsing his speech to the two thieves. 

This is him finding the switch:
The conversation I am quoting from is where Blote is establishing that he did not realize time travel was possible, and then Dan tells him that he can show him how to make a time machine:

.  Your theory is partially right, but Dan is not hired by Blote, (i can show ev for this latr), he is just curious about the heists, and he does take the theives vehicle out of curiosity, and realizes it is not a time machine after Blote's explanation. then they go to the factory because Dan promises Blote to show him a time machine

Whoever the honest debater is please go through the debate and help me find what is the most important claim and what is it I'm missing

III time skip
A, I specifically asked you to provide quotes in between 3045 and 4667, instead you quote at the end where B says they actually do get a time machine, but it's not the blue spectral vehicle from the thieves...
B, if time skip is not real it should be easy to refute why "the Future" speech A claims Dan is preparing is some sort of misquote

IV blue vehicle actually isnt time machine
A or B. Give me context (pronouns) for Blote convo. B is inconsistent and now saying Dan wasnt hired by Blote (+ Dan not Blote has time machine) B prove "that" in 4764-4801 is referring to the blue spectral vehicle

its a pretty confusing story because of the whole timeskip: im guessing that you want ev that beginning of heist is present, and after ~3045 is past, and the story cuts back to present but it cuts abruptly without ever going back to present; the last line is literally a question:

there is just one machine/vehicle talked about the entire time. I am not sure which ev B has that clearly showed that there was a dif machine. its the same "blue vehicle" beginning and end. 

Also Dan is clearly hired by Blote and they travel together:
so B is lying here. im out of wrd but can prove

To recap, Dan is curious about art heists, so he poses as a security guard in a vault where a new heist occurs, and the theives use a interdimensional machine to steal art. Dan gets the machine from the thieves, commandeers it and meets its owner, Blote, and then the exchange I have quoted ensues, where Blote tells Dan the machine is not a time machine, but due to Blote's curiosity they make a deal. - this is where Dan is 'hired', not previously, where we deal with the blue light emitting machine. If you look at the quote page it might clear up confusion, as you can read the conversation chronologically.

This debate has gone on too long so I went back n Im deciding based on ev n args
III
A, you can't prove that there ever was a time skip. Sorry B for not believing this earlier, it's just these stories can be weird, n debaters sometimes ignore what judges ask for. Also, idk if it's bc there's no evidence but you dont engage with the Future speech 1376-1412 from A when I asked you to last round
IV
B, you messed up bc you didnt clarify Blote doesnt hire Dan as a guard to prevent heist which i misunderstood since round3. Thought Dan wants/is with thieves see A 1st speech. But A's latest ev abt accompany makes me think Dan isn't security for Blote's art. So I believe Blote new char search time mach together. You also dont prove that in 4764-4801

answers.reason for outcome: I won because there was more evidence for the true prompt, and the other debater was forced to lie

this took a long time, i think the honest debater and i misunderstood each other. but i took more rounds. and eventually dishonest debater couldn't back up what i wanted with quotes - rereading the debate to realize this was also helpful
